00036     boost::tuple<RealMatrix, RealMatrix, RealMatrix> svd(RealMatrix& M) {
00037       f77int m = M.rows();
00038       f77int n = M.cols();
00039       f77int sn = m<n ? m : n;
00040       long estimate = (m*m + n*n + m*n + sn) * sizeof(float);
00041       // This is somewhat vestigial...  We continue to estimate the
00042       // total storage required for the SVD in case we want to do
00043       // something with it in the future...
00044 
00045 
00046 
00047       char jobu = 'A', jobvt = 'A';
00048       f77int lda = m, ldu = m, ldvt = n, lwork= -1, info;
00049       float prework[10], *work;
00050     
00051       RealMatrix U(m, m);
00052       RealMatrix S(sn, 1);
00053       RealMatrix Vt(n, n);
00054 
00055       sgesvd_(&jobu, &jobvt, &m, &n, M.get(), &lda, S.get(), U.get(), &ldu, Vt.get(), &ldvt, prework, &lwork, &info);
00056       if (info != 0)
00057         throw(NumericalError("Failure in SVD"));
00058 
00059       lwork = (f77int)prework[0];
00060       estimate += lwork * sizeof(double);
00061       work = new float[lwork];
00062 
00063       sgesvd_(&jobu, &jobvt, &m, &n, M.get(), &lda, S.get(), U.get(), &ldu, Vt.get(), &ldvt, work, &lwork, &info);
00064 
00065       boost::tuple<RealMatrix, RealMatrix, RealMatrix> result(U, S, Vt);
00066       return(result);
00067     }
00068

00071     boost::tuple<DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix> svd(DoubleMatrix& M) {
00072       f77int m = M.rows();
00073       f77int n = M.cols();
00074       f77int sn = m<n ? m : n;
00075       long estimate = (m*m + n*n + m*n + sn) * sizeof(double);
00076 
00077 
00078       char jobu = 'A', jobvt = 'A';
00079       f77int lda = m, ldu = m, ldvt = n, lwork= -1, info;
00080       double prework[10], *work;
00081     
00082       DoubleMatrix U(m, m);
00083       DoubleMatrix S(sn, 1);
00084       DoubleMatrix Vt(n, n);
00085 
00086       dgesvd_(&jobu, &jobvt, &m, &n, M.get(), &lda, S.get(), U.get(), &ldu, Vt.get(), &ldvt, prework, &lwork, &info);
00087       if (info != 0)
00088         throw(NumericalError("Failure in SVD"));
00089 
00090 
00091       lwork = (f77int)prework[0];
00092       estimate += lwork * sizeof(double);
00093       work = new double[lwork];
00094 
00095       dgesvd_(&jobu, &jobvt, &m, &n, M.get(), &lda, S.get(), U.get(), &ldu, Vt.get(), &ldvt, work, &lwork, &info);
00096 
00097       boost::tuple<DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix> result(U, S, Vt);
00098       return(result);
00099     }

00101     // Multiply two matrices using BLAS
00102 
00103     RealMatrix MMMultiply(const RealMatrix& A, const RealMatrix& B, const bool transa, const bool transb) {
00104 
00105       f77int m = transa ? A.cols() : A.rows();
00106       f77int n = transb ? B.rows() : B.cols();
00107       f77int k = transa ? A.rows() : A.cols();
00108       float alpha = 1.0;
00109       float beta = 0.0;
00110 
00111       f77int lda = transa ? k : m;
00112       f77int ldb = transb ? n : k;
00113       f77int ldc = m;
00114 
00115 
00116       RealMatrix C(m, n);
00117 
00118 #if defined(__linux__)
00119       char ta = (transa ? 'T' : 'N');
00120       char tb = (transb ? 'T' : 'N');
00121 
00122       sgemm_(&ta, &tb, &m, &n, &k, &alpha, A.get(), &lda, B.get(), &ldb, &beta, C.get(), &ldc);
00123 #else
00124       cblas_sgemm(CblasColMajor, transa ? CblasTrans : CblasNoTrans, transb ? CblasTrans : CblasNoTrans,
00125                   m, n, k, alpha, A.get(), lda, B.get(), ldb, beta, C.get(), ldc);
00126 #endif
00127 
00128       return(C);
00129     }
00130 
00131 
00132     DoubleMatrix MMMultiply(const DoubleMatrix& A, const DoubleMatrix& B, const bool transa, const bool transb) {
00133 
00134       f77int m = transa ? A.cols() : A.rows();
00135       f77int n = transb ? B.rows() : B.cols();
00136       f77int k = transa ? A.rows() : A.cols();
00137       double alpha = 1.0;
00138       double beta = 0.0;
00139 
00140       f77int lda = transa ? k : m;
00141       f77int ldb = transb ? n : k;
00142       f77int ldc = m;
00143 
00144 
00145       DoubleMatrix C(m, n);
00146 
00147 #if defined(__linux__)
00148       char ta = (transa ? 'T' : 'N');
00149       char tb = (transb ? 'T' : 'N');
00150 
00151       dgemm_(&ta, &tb, &m, &n, &k, &alpha, A.get(), &lda, B.get(), &ldb, &beta, C.get(), &ldc);
00152 #else
00153       cblas_dgemm(CblasColMajor, transa ? CblasTrans : CblasNoTrans, transb ? CblasTrans : CblasNoTrans,
00154                   m, n, k, alpha, A.get(), lda, B.get(), ldb, beta, C.get(), ldc);
00155 #endif
00156 
00157       return(C);
00158     }

00161     // Pseudo-inverse of a matrix using the SVD
00162 
00163     RealMatrix invert(RealMatrix& A, const float eps) {
00164 
00165       // The SVD (at least dgesvd) will destroy the source matrix, so we
00166       // need to make an explicit copy...
00167 
00168       RealMatrix B(A.copy());
00169       boost::tuple<RealMatrix, RealMatrix, RealMatrix> res = svd(B);
00170       RealMatrix U(boost::get<0>(res));
00171       RealMatrix S(boost::get<1>(res));
00172       RealMatrix Vt(boost::get<2>(res));
00173 
00174 
00175       for (uint i=0; i<Vt.rows(); ++i) {
00176         double sv = S[i];
00177         if (sv < eps)
00178           sv = 0.0;
00179         else
00180           sv = 1.0 / sv;
00181 
00182         for (uint j=0; j<Vt.cols(); ++j)
00183           Vt(i,j) *= sv;
00184       }
00185 
00186       RealMatrix Ai = MMMultiply(Vt, U, true, true);
00187       return(Ai);
00188     }
00189 
00190 
00191     DoubleMatrix invert(DoubleMatrix& A, const double eps) {
00192 
00193       // The SVD (at least dgesvd) will destroy the source matrix, so we
00194       // need to make an explicit copy...
00195 
00196       DoubleMatrix B(A.copy());
00197       boost::tuple<DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix, DoubleMatrix> res = svd(B);
00198       DoubleMatrix U(boost::get<0>(res));
00199       DoubleMatrix S(boost::get<1>(res));
00200       DoubleMatrix Vt(boost::get<2>(res));
00201 
00202 
00203       for (uint i=0; i<Vt.rows(); ++i) {
00204         double sv = S[i];
00205         if (sv < eps)
00206           sv = 0.0;
00207         else
00208           sv = 1.0 / sv;
00209 
00210         for (uint j=0; j<Vt.cols(); ++j)
00211           Vt(i,j) *= sv;
00212       }
00213 
00214       DoubleMatrix Ai = MMMultiply(Vt, U, true, true);
00215       return(Ai);
00216     }

00219     void operator+=(RealMatrix& A, const RealMatrix& B) {
00220       if (A.rows() != B.rows() || A.cols() != B.cols())
00221         throw(std::logic_error("Matrices are not the same size"));
00222 
00223       for (uint i=0; i<A.rows() * A.cols(); ++i)
00224         A[i] += B[i];
00225     }
00226 
00227     RealMatrix operator+(const RealMatrix& A, const RealMatrix& B) {
00228       RealMatrix C(A.copy());
00229       C += B;
00230       return(C);
00231     }

00251     void operator-=(RealMatrix& A, const RealMatrix& B) {
00252       if (A.rows() != B.rows() || A.cols() != B.cols())
00253         throw(std::logic_error("Matrices are not the same size"));
00254 
00255       for (uint i=0; i<A.rows() * A.cols(); ++i)
00256         A[i] -= B[i];
00257     }

00284     void operator*=(RealMatrix& A, const float d) {
00285       for (uint i=0; i<A.rows() * A.cols(); ++i)
00286         A[i] *= d;
00287     }

00291       B *= d;
00292       return(B);

00295     void operator*=(RealMatrix& A, const RealMatrix& B) {

00297       A=C;

00331     RealMatrix operator-(RealMatrix& A) {
00332       RealMatrix B(A.copy());
00333       for (uint i=0; i<B.rows() * B.cols(); ++i)
00334         B[i] = -B[i];
00335       return(B);
00336     }
00337

00339     DoubleMatrix operator-(DoubleMatrix& A) {
00340       DoubleMatrix B(A.copy());
00341       for (uint i=0; i<B.rows() * B.cols(); ++i)
00342         B[i] = -B[i];
00343       return(B);
00344     }

00347     // Create a square identity matrix
00348 
00349     RealMatrix eye(const uint n) {
00350       RealMatrix I(n, n);
00351       for (uint i=0; i<n; ++i)
00352         I(i,i) = 1.0;
00353 
00354       return(I);
00355     }
00356 
00357     DoubleMatrix deye(const uint n) {
00358       DoubleMatrix I(n, n);
00359       for (uint i=0; i<n; ++i)
00360         I(i, i) = 1.0;
00361 
00362       return(I);
00363     }
